Name: git
Description: `git` is a version control system used to track changes in source code during software development.

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Initialize a new Git repository in the current directory.

Arguments.Name: clone
Arguments.Description: It creates a copy of a remote repository on your local machine.

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: It stages changes in the working directory for the next commit.

Arguments.Name: status
Arguments.Description: Displays the current status of the repository, including changes to tracked files.

Arguments.Name: commit
Arguments.Description: The `commit` command saves changes to the local Git repository.

Arguments.Name: push
Arguments.Description: The `push` argument command uploads local repository changes to a remote repository.

Arguments.Name: pull
Arguments.Description: It fetches changes from a remote repository and integrates them into the current branch.

Arguments.Name: checkout
Arguments.Description: Switches between different branches or restores files in the working directory.

Arguments.Name: branch
Arguments.Description: Creates, lists, renames, or deletes branches in a Git repository.

Arguments.Name: merge
Arguments.Description: It combines changes from different branches into one branch.

Arguments.Name: log
Arguments.Description: It displays a history of commits in a repository.

Arguments.Name: diff
Arguments.Description: The `diff` argument command shows the differences between two sets of files.

Arguments.Name: reset
Arguments.Description: The `reset` command undoes changes and resets the working directory to a specific state.

Arguments.Name: revert
Arguments.Description: It undoes the changes made by a specific commit.

Arguments.Name: fetch
Arguments.Description: Updates your local repository with changes from a remote repository.

Arguments.Name: remote
Arguments.Description: The `remote` argument allows you to manage remote repositories for your local git repository.

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: The `config` argument command sets configuration values for your Git installation.

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Displays a specific object or objects.

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Provides information on available commands and their usage within a tool or system.

Arguments.Name: pathname
Arguments.Description: The path argument passed to the git command specifies the location of the repository or files to be operated on.
